title: PowerShell MCP Security Classification System
body: PowerShell Enterprise MCP Server implements 5-level security classification system: SAFE (ðŸŸ¢) - Read-only operations like Get-*, Show-*, Test-*, Out-*, Write-*, Format-*, Select-*, Where-Object, Sort-Object that execute freely; RISKY (ðŸŸ¡) - File operations (Remove-Item, Move-Item, Copy-Item), service operations (Start-Service, Restart-Service), process management (Stop-Process) that require 'confirmed: true' parameter; DANGEROUS (ðŸŸ£) - System modifications (Stop-Computer, Restart-Computer), user management (New-LocalUser, Remove-LocalUser), service disabling (Set-Service Disabled), event log clearing (Clear-EventLog) that are blocked; CRITICAL (ðŸ”´) - Hidden execution (powershell -WindowStyle Hidden), encoded commands (powershell -EncodedCommand), downloads (DownloadString, WebClient), binary execution (cmd.exe, wscript.exe) that are blocked; BLOCKED (ðŸš«) - Registry modifications (HKLM, HKCU), system file operations (C:\Windows\System32), root drive operations (Format-Volume C:), remote machine modifications that are completely prohibited.
